Pre-Game Insights: Regragui spoke of the effectiveness and the limits of the offensive strategy he used against Gabon.
The match against Lesotho will enable his team to tighten up spaces and be strong in the battle for second balls.
Regragui pledged to give opportunities to young players during today’s match to gain in confidence and maturity.
The Atlas Lions are well aware that no match is a walkover in Africa, a lesson learned from experiences in both previous AFCON tournaments and qualifiers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will take place at 8 p.m.
Both Morocco’s Arriyadia sports channel and beIn Sports 1 broadcast tonight’s game.
